    1. parse(String)

Interface PropertyValueParser<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the target type produced by the parser
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultPropertyValueParser
public interface PropertyValueParser<T>
Strategy interface for converting raw property values (strings) into application types.

This interface defines a simple contract used by property-binding utilities: given the textual representation of a property value, return an instance of the desired target type T.

Contract

  • Implementations should be side-effect free and deterministic for a given input string.
  • Implementations must handle null or empty input according to the needs of the consumer â€” either by returning null, a sensible default, or by throwing an unchecked exception. Document the chosen behavior in your implementation.
  • Implementations are typically stateless and can be reused across multiple bindings; if state is required, ensure thread-safety.

Usage example


 // A parser for integers
 public class IntegerPropertyValueParser implements PropertyValueParser<Integer> {
     @Override
     public Integer parse(String value) {
         return value == null || value.isEmpty() ? null : Integer.valueOf(value);
     }
 }

 // A parser for boolean values
 public class BooleanPropertyValueParser implements PropertyValueParser<Boolean> {
     @Override
     public Boolean parse(String value) {
         return value == null ? null : Boolean.parseBoolean(value.trim());
     }
 }

 // Registration/usage (conceptual):
 // @PropertyKey(key = "app.port", parser = IntegerPropertyValueParser.class)
 // private int port;
